Reviews.Title: “best location with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: faysal-farooqi
Reviews.Content: Situated at one of the best location of Singapore. MRT is hardly 2-3 minutes walk away. Though not surrounded by big shopping malls & restaurants but there are 7/11 & other stores of essential items. One can find internet cafe at walking distance. I stayed 4 nights in this hotel with my family & very much satisfied with the service. Rooms are very clean. Breakfast is complementry with great variety of food. Pool is too good that my kids just love to swim all the time. Well, rooms are not much spacious but it's adjustable. If you have naughty kids like mine, then be carefull, generally, people of Singapore don't like kids. I remember the expressions of that immigration officer when my kids were shouting for water. Even in the room, our next door guest kicked our door & ran off. Overall, room, service & specially staff, all are very good. If you don't want to travel in MRT, then Taxis are always around there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caloundrians
Reviews.Content: The Amara Hotel is a very nice hotel in Singapore in a very convenient position. The staff were always very helpful and informative and prepared to do the extra required to make a difference to the holidaymaker. We were allocated a smoking room and when we requested a change to a non smoking it was done cheerfully and immediately. We received good advice from the Concierge who was very helpful and cheerful. The only imperfect area of our holiday was the beds, too hard, although very supportive, they need a layer of foam over the top of the springs. This would make the hotel close to perfect. The hotel restaurants we ate in were also excellent. Having free wireless internet was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Club Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ainaa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club room in January 2011, my review is a bit late but based on my experience I would happily stay here again. The rooms were clean, the Club Floor staff were friendly and helpful. They always have somebody at the reception on the club floor and would personally know your names. The breakfast/cocktail menu was small compared to other club floor spread but it was very good nonetheless. The hotel is adjoined to a small shopping centre which had a chemist, wine shop, coffee shop etc which was handy to have. The hotel is maybe a 10 minute walk to Chinatown and to Maxwell Hawker Centre. It is not near an MRT station so maybe some people would not like that, but if you are taking taxis to get around Singapore then this hotel is pretty central. I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in a Club Room as I did, the staff there were so friendly and willing to go the extra mile. When we checked out we forgot some receipts which we wanted to claim the GST on, so we rang the hotel and asked that they look for it in our room and post it to us and they did! Club Floor staff gets a 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay but could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: Hari22nair
Reviews.Content: The staff was cheerful ... and very welcoming... I checked in early at 9am and there were charges levied approx 180 SGD.... ! This is ok as they allotted some club floor rooms. It was smoking room which i wants aware. Went to relax and they bed linen were stinking badly of the smoke. I told the reception and room service; but no change done. Evening i requested again and then the change happened. Rooms were large and spacious. The hotel has lovely restaurants especially Thai food at floor 2... called Thankyong. Simply superb! At the basement there is Prague Bar which has its brewery machinery inside the cafe. Nice beer but the Peranakan food served wasnt that great! (go down in the basement and take right on the road to find the BLUE GINGER restaurant) Overall the location and experience was nice; it takes hardly 10 dollars to reach Sentosa. Chinatown is 10 min walkable distance. Must visit nearly OneRafflesSpace Altitude Bar; its the tallest building in Singapore having an open bar in the terrace (top most floor)

Reviews.Title: “Amara very good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Seanyw
Reviews.Content: The Amara is a modern very smart business hotel in the heart of Singapore. I booked online for business and when I checked in I was upgraded free of charge to Club floor on floor 18. The rooms are well decorated and smart. The free internet access wif-fi and wired were fast and reliable. Good desk in the room to work from. Although I was upgraded to the club floor I wasn't permitted to eat breakfast in the club lounge which was a shame. Check out is 12 Noon but I asked for a late check out. They gave me a free of charge check out time of 3pm which was greatly appreciated. The room is well sound proofed and the bed was comfortable. Now the bits that could be improved. I was disappointed with the shower, the pressure was very low and not showers I am used to in International hotels. The shower water temperature was poor also, It took a quite to reach hot and then was too hot. Hard to maintain the correct shower temperature. The other disappointment was breakfast in the lobby. After signing in you are left to find your own table, pour your own coffee and fend for yourself. Again not what I am used to in a top International hotel, That said the business itself was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Blood stained sheets...”
Reviews.Author: bb1234bb
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel (Club Room) on the night of the 12th March 2012 - when I went to get into bed, I pulled back the covers and to my horror and disgust I noticed blood spots (dried) on my sheets, naturally I phoned the front desk, they asked if I wanted to move room, as I'd already unpacked, showered etc and was ready for bed I declined - they sent housekeeping to change the sheets. I took pictures of the sheets. I was out of the hotel in the morning, spent all day working, returned around 18:30pm to find the hotel in darkness - a power cut. Had to mill around the lobby for about an hour whilst they got the lifts working. The power cut isn't my issue with the hotel (although I was without hot water for over 24 hours, had to have 3 cold showers, plus no internet). My issue with the hotel is the manner (or rather lack of) in which they responded about my blood stained sheets. I asked for an apology (at the front desk) from the GM on the Tuesday. Wednesday nothing, so I asked again. Wednesday evening when I returned, nothing, so I asked again on Thursday (morning) for an apology - again nothing when I returned. I checked out Friday morning, I asked again at the front desk - they had the audacity to say that I'd received an apology from the GM - an absolute lie. I don't know about you, but I'd be horrified if I put dirty sheets on a bed for a guest, let alone a paying guest. On the Tuesday evening I asked the front desk (later in the evening) when the power went out - they told me 8pm - this was a lie, I was at the hotel at 6:30pm. Plus my fellow work colleagues were told the power went out much before. I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 3~4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: movenpick11
Reviews.Content: This was my third time visiting singapore and I had stayed at Carlton and excelsior hotel. I got a great deal at agoda. The hotel is located right next to Tanjong Pagar MRT station which is 4 stops away from Orchard street, which is the main street of singapore. First impression of the hotel was great. Upon check-in, hotel staffs were very kind and ready to serve my demands. I didnt have a breakfast option because there are tons of eating places right across the hotel, where there were full of Singaporeans (also very cheap).I would stay again if I get the same deal for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Mayay
Reviews.Content: This hotel has convenient location, although now there is a nearby construction going on in day time. The chief concierge Mr Michael Wo has been very helpful. Having a truly caring staff does make a whole lot of difference to tourists. Thanks Mr Wo!!

Reviews.Title: “WYSIWYG”
Reviews.Author: JugalM
Reviews.Content: What You See Is What You Get.... exactly what a Business hotel should be like.. Decently sized room, spacious bathroom.. I would strongly recommend you to try the freshly brewed beer at the Prague Microbrewery

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best.”
Reviews.Author: lovetripsdd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the central business district of Singapore. Chinatown and Maxwell Food Center are about a 15 minute walk away . Line of restaurants within a walking distance. A plaza located across. Booked an executive room. Pros: Very spacious. Clean. 24-hour gym. Very nice pool. High speed wired and wireless internet available. Some staff, like the Assistant Manager and the one in charge of Housekeeping, were very helpful. About 3 minutes walk to the MRT. Buffet breakfast. Fruit bowl on every floor. Cons: Surprisingly for a 4-star hotel, most of the line staff were not conversant in English. And, I think, in their uncertainty about the language they appear rude. 1 receptionist sounded irritated and condascending when I inquired about the internet (the Assistant Manager on duty saved the situtation from becoming a disaster, he was nice enough to personally assist me). While another dropped my call on the pretext of putting me on hold, I was even the one who had to call back (after giving it a few minutes to give her a chance to call me back). Also, for a 4-star hotel, some small details are not quite perfect - the leaking faucet, the hard to control and oft times temperamental shower, the lazy doormen...

Reviews.Title: “Amara Hotel has a convenient location and is just fine”
Reviews.Author: Scubaqueen_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near Chinatown- a short walk to the Chinatown Metro. The room was fairly spacious and the bathroom was nice with a tub and separate shower. It's nothing fancy, but was just fine for the couple of nights we spent. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for work, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cam_sydney4
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Amara on a couple of occassions for work whilst in Singapore. The Hotel is pretty well located for my offices, and is close to Tangong Pajar MRT station (it's easy to get almost anywhere from there!). Hotel is always clean, and the pub on the corner is good. Breakfasts are standard hotel fare and nothing special. Wouldn't use it as a romantic hotel, nor too good for families. Hookers on the corner late at night!

Reviews.Title: “tasteful, spotless, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: whereintheworldisgpc
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights over new years in this very clean and modern hotel located in/near Chinatown with a friendly staff who are eager to help at all times. When we arrived there were constructions ongoing and the noise level at the reception was immense. When pointing this out, we were given a room in a higher floor where the noise couldn’t be heard anymore. The rooms are tastefully set up, the bathrooms are spacious and spotless and even Wifi is free although not working perfectly at all times. The pool area is “stylish”, the view little spectacular. The hotel is located about 3-4 minutes to the MRT station and in walking reach of all sights in China town. The area feels just as safe as the rest of the city. The only downside really was the price at the time which was probably higher due to New Years. Recommendable for everyone who is looking for a modern, tasteful and spotless place in town.

Reviews.Title: “Looks tired already”
Reviews.Author: LeoCPH
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel because I missed the connecting flight in Singapore. Nothing special about this place. I guess it's ok for short stay. The location is not the best in town. I'm not sure how old this hotel is but the room has shown some needs for improvement. The bathroom wall surely needs new round of painting and new towels. Some scratches here and there on furnitures. The food at the restaurant and breakfast were not bad though but I doubt it's the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “Please compare the rates first!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mk t
Reviews.Content: Please compare your rates first before you make the booking. Especially booking with agoda.com which stated that they having the best rates. Actually, i had been booking with agoda.com for so long time. But just recently i noticed that actually they were not having the best rates, once i tried to compare with others. Finally, i found that the rate given in the agoda.com was not worth it as the rates for agoda.com was excluded breakfast, without wi-fi and standard room. The hotel rates which provided by hotel itself is just a little bit higher, included breakfast for 2, free wi-fi and executive room. Further, on the process in booking, i noticed that the agoda.com was failure to disclose the actual packages which caused confusion on the consumers. Therefore, i had also made several complaints to them in calls and emails. However, they just keep ignoring and muddle through. So better check properly the packages and rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: rajeshnaik21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in January 2012 The hotel location is away from the centre of the city and happening places. Near to the Tanjong pagar MRT. The entire staff except one lady at the reception,who seemingly is the team leader,as she behaved was unpleasant.Was very loud and behaving in an nature intimidating manner. Similar to most of the things in Singapore,this one is quite an expensive hotel with ni value for money offered. So called corporate discounted room cost me 349 SGD per night inclusive on taxes without any breakfast. For the price you pay,it is not worth the money. Otherwise,on other parts it is OK in terms of cleanliness and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Been a happy regular guest for the past 5 years but service needs improvement and consistency”
Reviews.Author: Maria Jessica B
Reviews.Content: I've always stayed in Amara for my business trips since 2006, and generally I am satisfied with the overall experience. I've grown to know some of the staff members, and it's always pleasant to be greeted by a smile from familiar faces, some already addressing me by my name (like Mr. Amin, Santi, Trina). For a frequent traveler like me, it makes every trip less stressful and more memorable whenever you stay at a hotel that makes you feel closer to home. However, I have noticed that over the years, service has deteriorated. While the front desk staff has been consistently courteous and warm, the room service staff, particularly the lady who always answers to take orders, lacks courtesy, always in a hurry and quite moody (sometimes she is flexible with tiny special requests, and sometimes she is not and won't budge). The old cleaning lady is also quite abrasive; once even taking my room key card out of the slot while i was away, and taking it with her! I understand the need to eco-save, but for me, I have always wanted to come back to a cool room, especially after a long and hard day at work. I did not like it that she got the key and took it away just like that. Lastly, I hope the hotel can also evaluate and improve its in-room dining presentation. I noticed that some dishes that I would regularly order, are not presented in a consistent manner. There are days when it is nicely put together, and there are days when, for the same dish, it doesn't have some of the usual add-on like jam, bread on the side, etc. When you're a regular guest, you easily notice these things and feel shortchanged when what you used to get is much better than what you're getting now. I stay in Amara not only because it's right across my office, but because I've learned to make my stay comfortable and easy here already. However, if these disappointing things continue to show, I guess I will re-think it next time, and maybe choose to stay elsewhere, even if I have to pay extra for cab fare everyday.

Reviews.Title: “ideally located business hotel but relatively poor service”
Reviews.Author: charoos
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in this hotel in last one year; but alas this time I was disappointed. Although the hotel is conveniently located, but the quality of service has deteriorated over the period. The rooms are equipped below expectation and the staff is average.

Reviews.Title: “Amara Singapore Plus”
Reviews.Author: darylwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis on Bencoolen two years ago and decided to go with this hotel this time since I was traveling with family and needed a pool. The location is very ideal. It is in the southernmost part of the CBD, three blocks from the Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. It has a Fair Price grocery and a Seven Eleven across the street from the hotel. ATMs there as well. The room was more than adequate. The beds seems hard but actually are comfortable enough because I slept fine. Warning: for those that complain about every little noise, you may love this hotel. The A/C makes no noise so it is dead quiet in the room at night. Not much street noise at all (up on the 10th floor at least). I'm used to a little noise in the room from the A/C. So just saying, for those that just hate every little noise in the natural or man-made world, this hotel is definitely for you. As for a higher floor. The staff here was great. They were attentive to all of my needs including lost luggage from the airport and internet setup. They also took care of calling taxis. The staff at this hotel really was first rate. The 6th floor pool also is wonderful. It is very long, like a lap pool, but still wide enough too. It looks fabulous. I'll try to add pictures. I didn't try the gym or the tennis court. Newspapers were in the elevator lobby every morning. The ice machine on the 10th floor didn't work but the one on the 9th did. The elevators are room key access above a certain floor. Room service was performed very well also. The bathroom does not lock and has one of those clear type windows on the door but you can't see through it. I prefer private bathrooms but this one wasn't such a big deal. I mean, you can tell when someone is in the bathroom so don't walk in on them. The rainfall showerhead was nice. We ate at the Chinese restaurant on site on the second floor and it was very good. It was expensive, but very good. I would recommend it for certain. You are a good 20-30 walk from Chinatown and Clarke Quay from this hotel. It's a long walk. Fine for in the morning just starting out but horrible by the end of the day when you're tired, hot and sweaty. Taxi's all know this hotel and the MRT is close by also. So basically, if you're a person who wants to be in the middle of action, such as Chinatown, Clarke Quay or shopping, then you may want to try to look closer to Clarke Quay or Orchard Road. But if you don't mind public transit and want a super nice hotel with a very awesome pool, this is y our hotel. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, nice location”
Reviews.Author: JanieOctia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Amara twice and I must say the service is very efficient. The check in is done in less than 10 minutes and twice I arrived around 12 noon and my rooms are ready. The breakfast is a wide selection of Asian and western cuisine but the area can get crowded in the morning. The location is walking distance to Tanjong Pagar MRT station, there's a bus stop across the street and it's very easy to hail a cab in the area. There's also a grocery store and some nearby food shops in front that's open until around 10 in the evening even on weekends. The last time I was here when i was checking in, i noticed that an authorization letter from one guest with credit card details written is exposed at the counter. Had to call the attention of the staff as that definitely made so uncomfortable. I leave my card details too for so the fact that they're careless with those things is a little alarming. They listened though but that seriously made me think about staying there again. Other than that, it was a good experience. I usually stay here for a week and so far, that has been pretty smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Amara Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne E
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, efficient staff. Did not eat in hotel as we wanted to live more cheaply. Loved the rooms and the pillows on the beds were sooo comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms very adequate, close to metro and chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra_BT_Hannon
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms, great pool and gym. Friendly reception, great selection of business meetings room, ours was very well serviced too. Plenty of staff, always ready to lend a hand. Not quite sure about the 4 star rating buts the hotel is fine. The crockery in my rooms was not very clean. Pity!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Lobby, Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessZan
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the lobby, I was rather disappointed at first what with it looking like a two star crappy hotel (and yes!! A Filipino band was bawling out some deafening stale tune) BUT the staff at the reception was friendly and helpful and gave me a very good room for a song.. The bed was huge and comfortable. The room clean and tidy and a far cry from the awful hotels in France which I had visited a few days ago.....I'd stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over Christmas, good location and US-sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: sasNc
Reviews.Content: Good, clean hotel with excellent facilities and amenities. Great location in center city next to Chinatown and really close to a metro station from which you can quickly get anywhere. We got an excellent deal since it caters to business travelers but we were staying over Christmas holiday when travel is down. Staff was very nice and let us check in really early after we arrived on a 6 am flight. The room size is plenty big and what an American traveler would expect for the price. The tall building meant many rooms above the fray of the street below. If space and the comforts of a modern hotel are important to you, skip the tiny and old chinatown boutiques and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worse the second time”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: After the truly awful experience I had before, I was enticed back by the offer if an upgrade. Bad move A catalogue of faults and errors, including brown tapwater (which it appears they already knew about) and a toilet which repeatedly siphoned back. When I asked for the water to be checked, the housekeeper went straight in and flushed the toilet, then came out and called me an animal for not doing so myself. Believe me, if I had anything to feel embarassed about rather than enraged, I would not be writing abiut it in public forum This hotel is truly awful - avoid!

Reviews.Title: “All in all I had a pleasant four days”
Reviews.Author: TheRigrat
Reviews.Content: The internet wi-fi connection was pretty much uselss, but after I complained the IT staff fixed me up with my own router and from then on it was perfect. (Can't get better service than that) I found the Thai restaurant a little disappointing, staff were great, but the food was not perticularly good and was well overpriced $17 for three sweet and sour prawns in a canned sauce with a lot of cucumber. (I ordered sweet and sour prawns not cucumber) The incredibly annoying lifts which demand your room card are an irritant. Check in staff were welcoming and helpful. Room had wide screen TV, mini bar, and large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alvin H
Reviews.Content: Stay here couple of times in the superior room up to the suite rooms. It's rather basic hotel. The only plus point is it's near to my office. The Club Lounge offering is rather limited but it's slightly beyond expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: petiteld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in April, before getting the keys to our apartment. Price was fairly reasonable, with frequent attractive promotions on the website which we used. The room was OK, all was working well, the mattress was excellent, bed-linens of a good quality. Of course, it was clean (and by the way, the cleaning maid was really friendly). Aircon, as others have mentioned, is tricky to use and always goes back to polar temperature. What I not liked was that we could not open the windows in the building (as is unfortunately often the case in Sg) and therefore could not air the bedroom, hence a not so nice smell. Internet was working OK with the cable; wireless (on a tablet) was however not always available and disconnected regularly. I also appreciated the spa voucher for 10-15 mn back and shoulder massage. Swimming pool area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: leon777SG
Reviews.Content: Working overseas coming back to visit the country where you were born is always an enjoyable rush with the ever changing landscape of the city. I have stayed in this hotel various times over the years during my home trip and always find it a pleasure constant with the service and accommodations , although is it situated in business district and off the main shopping area it is still accessible to any part of the country by a underground mass transport station just 5 minutes walk , certainly a plus for Amara and one of the largest shopping center Vivo City at harbor bay and Sentosa Island is only 5 minutes away by taxi costing less than US$10. Chinatown is also 5 minutes away by taxi, Also there a 24/7 supermarket just across the street to the right of the hotel with a bank and a 7/11 store right in front of the hotel for all your daily needs. Some of the best local food such as Chicken Rice, etc can also be found at Maxwell and Old Market food court both within walking distance 10-15 minutes away, My recent trip had an upgrade to an executive level room which was a welcome surprise. Room was a nice size; bed was most comfortable with all the amenities in line with a deluxe hotel. Bathroom has a separate rain shower area & bathtub, a small minus is the bath towel was a thin and water pressure not constant. Aircon is one of the coldest, If you like a hotel room with a refreshing coolness you have to check out this hotel. I think most of the rooms have the similar facilities’ but with difference in the décor and design. I be back again in December with the family and intend to book in the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AmirahAnwar
Reviews.Content: My bf and I have been visiting Amara almost every weekend since the start of May 2011. We are very attracted to the promotional rates and perks given by the hotel. A couple of occasions, we hopped to two or three other hotels in the area. It went to an extend of requesting for our money to be refunded from one of the hotels. No more of such! Amara has a good vibe at the start of everything. From the free parking, to walking in the front entrance, to the pleasant service at the front desk, the fast elevators, spacious and awesome view rooms, convenient ice machine on every floor, spacious toilets (plus point!!), delicious spread of choices for breakfast (the pastries are amazing). Every little detail of our stay was beyond what we paid for. Value for money indeed!! I would like to particular mention a front desk staff of Amara Singapore, Ms Devi, who has without fail, given us the most excellent service on our every stay. The friendly and delightful service provided is one of the bigger reasons we choose to return each weekend! Looking forward for exciting offers from Amara to make our weekend escape from our workaholic work week worthwhile!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: crabtownc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good one for an extended stay in Singapore. The staff are friendly, helpful, and attentive. Rooms are clean, adequately spacious, and in good condition (I mention that because we've stayed places that weren't-- and I want to know). We enjoyed the executive lounge on the 17th floor: some guests were bold enough to make dinner of the complimentary drinks and goodies at happy hour: sushi to warm hors d'oeuvres and salads and fruits and desserts-- all were delicious. It is located near an MRT station and has a lovely pool, spa and there is a fitness center. There are in-house restaurants: Czech brewery, Thai, Korean, Chinese (only tried the Chinese-- not impressed, but many Chinese people seemed to be enjoying their meals). The breakfast buffet is impressive, with international offerings. As with many places here, there are a range of restaurants and fast food places nearby. Chinatown is a short walk. We've stayed here several times and will continue to do so, with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Awful - avoid if you are a Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: I arrived late off a delayed flight, having booked an Executive Room including free internet 1. The Desk phone didn't work (see below) and the Internet connection kept cutting out (I think others have commented on this); need to rekey the lengthy User Name and Password every time, which got tedious 2. So I tried to call Reception using the phone in the bathroom. No reply. Duty Manager. No reply. Concierge - goes to voicemail, telling you that the Voicemail box is full and can't accept any more messages. Room Service - guy tells me to phone Reception; I explain that there is nobody at Reception, whereupon he says sorry its not his problem - he's just Room Service 3. Got dressed (0200) went downstairs and found the Duty Manager, who came up to my room and announced that the Wifi wasn't working and the Phone was broken. Could I use Cable ethernet? No, not on a tablet, so he sent for a workman, who arrived just after 0200 and announced that the phone wasn't working and neither was the Wifi. By now, I was fairly familiar with that diagnosis, so off he went to get a new phone and a Wifi router. At 0230 I got to bed. 4. I set the aircon for 24 degrees, but it reverts every time to 21, which I find way too cold. Dial in 24, back it goes to 21 5. Got up in the morning, the wifi is working via the router, but still cuts out every 5 minutes, requiring you to rekey your lengthy User Name and Password..... This is clearly not a Business-friendly hotel There are FAR better alternatives in Singapore, and I checked out and went to the truly superb Mandarin Oriental; far more money, but at least everything works, the staff are helpful and attentive, and I didn't need to hunt for a blanket and/or a pullover

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PiaShome
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Amara from 13th Sep, 2011 till 16th Sep, 2011. I was in Singapore on a business trip. I liked the fact that they had a wonderful lobby, great rooms and a speedy check in process. I was allowed to check in around 4 hours before mt normal check in time. The room service men was good and service was prompt! They offered a free 10 minutes spa voucher which i used. I must comment that the facilities are workd class there It also has a good location and has a lovely Thai restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Many better hotels to choose from than this one”
Reviews.Author: CriticalChris
Reviews.Content: The Amara is in walking distance from Chinatown and is in a very good location. However, though it's a nice clean hotel there are many better hotels to choose from in Singapore. Upon arrival there is no particular "greeting" process as in most high end hotels. I never did see nor was I asked if I needed bell service. They simply give you your key, and tell you to go to the elevator. I had to ask where the breakfasts was served. I would not have noticed these seeming small details except that I can't recall a time that I did not having the reception desk take me through the details. You can get a lot more hotel here for the same money and some world class hotels for just a little more.

Reviews.Title: “We made a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Buketcicek
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Singapore. The hotel is situated in the Chinese part of the city, which is incredibly clean, the staff is kind, our room had beautiful view of the skyline of Singapore and the area of the swimming pool is wonderful. I noticed a lot of business people in the hotel. My friends and I didn't have any single remark on the service we got. I would really recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “nice break”
Reviews.Author: laura-david-abbie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks holiday in The Amara, I found the staff to be very helpful when we made enquiries at reception, we stayed in an executive room which was clean and presentable although i did find it was over priced for the standard of facalitiys. We went to the buffet for dinner which has an excellent choice of food and as a guest you receive 20% discount. Overall a nice break but as i said i found it to be overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful for business; mediocre for everything else.”
Reviews.Author: Rektikano
Reviews.Content: A comedy of errors. Avoid like the plague if you are on business. There is no internet facility - at least, no reliable facility, in that it times out every 10 minutes and requires you to log in all over again. That is, when it works at all. The desks are so tiny - more of a shelf running along a few yards of the wall - that you can barely fit a laptop on them; forget it if you want to open some papers/files as well. You will sleep poorly if the hotel staff and guests shout as loudly as they do in the corridors at - what was it - 1am and 8am. On top of this, there was an interesting palette of various yellows underneath the WC in the bathroom, and food on the carpet. No pool attendant by the pool, no towels there either (they were hidden under the counter). Noisy air conditioning, and the cheapest possible jams for breakfast - the sort you would have found in a cheap English B&B circa 1978. Don't worry about calling reception as the phones ring out - this happend three times in 24 hours. Surely this is not a five star hotel? At least the restaurants are good. That is the one saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Good corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: stressbunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights unintentionally as our flight was cancelled and had to urgently book accommodation from airport. Paid heaps for the executive club floor (level 18) which was great as drinks and extensive canapes (more like a meal) are available from 6pm plus you can have breakfast there too. Balinese pool area is nice but unfortunately shaded by nearby buildings and you are very aware this is a corporate CBD hotel rather than a place of relaxation. Staff seemed very new to the job and/or had poor grasp of english

Reviews.Title: “It was good stay at Amara Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Dilesh_Pardhi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel from 21 June 2011 to 24 June 2011 and I found hotel is good, good service,,,Staff was very much cooperative, ,,located centrally and good accessibility..I would like to stay again in this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel! Don't even think of booking this hotel. My kids were poisoned in their restaurant. Bed bugs, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: malmonmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after our flight got cancelled. Booked 3 rooms for my family. Had breakfast in their hotel. My kids drank contaminated poisoned milk. My kids got hospitalized for almost a week. No action done by the hotel's management. Stay out of this hotel or you'll be sorry. Spoiled our holiday because of that experience. Very expensive not worth the stay. Poor customer service. Stay away pls!

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: particular_travel
Reviews.Content: The stay in the hotel was very pleasant. I got a newly furbished room with a good bed and a nice, big bathroom. It's especially important to point out that the room was cleaned carefully every day. The staff was always friendly and helpful; the atmosphere in the reception area is also nice and welcoming. The only unpleasant experience was, after having landed at 6 am and wanting to check-in early, the extra fee of SGD 170. This amount seemed far to high for me.

Reviews.Title: “Confused receptionists”
Reviews.Author: sukri_karim2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference in June and I arrived just before the start of the conference. Knowing that I could be charged for early check in, I asked the 'seemed to be not-so-fluent English speaking mainland China receptionist' about the total room cost. She answered it is SGD176. I assumed she answered my question but later upon checking out, she meant the extra early check in cost on top of the room rate of SGD250! This bring the total room cost to almost SGD500 including taxes. I am very disappointed in this because I believe she should explain further about the early check in cost. In addition, the WI-FI internet service is poor. I have to make few calls and made to wait including talking to external ISP people when they should resolve the matter for me. It's not guest responsibility to resolve his/her hotel room internet with the internet service provider people. I think it is very inappropriate. In the end, they suggested that I used land LAN cable which is not convenient. In terms of room, it is fantastic but please improve your receptionist English. Buffet breakfast options is also limited. Not great.

Reviews.Title: “An Amaging place to relax & reenrgize”
Reviews.Author: Dilep
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel i have seen whichcan cater everyone's taste. Amzing food, Best qualitative service and beautiful ambiance.Its in the centre of the city and close to shopping centre. The hotel staff were very coordial and helpful. you can get variety of food. Besides that it also encompass shopping area in the building. U have a beautiful swiming pool and a wel equiped gym.

Reviews.Title: “Kind and helpful service, but dirty and uncomfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: The Amara Singapore has a really nice lobby, restaurants and pool area, which hides the lackluster rooms quite well. I arrived late afternoon after a long day of travelling and was given a confusing and filthy room. I walked in to see two twin beds pushed together which I thought was odd as a single traveler. There was no alarm clock, broken glass on the floor of the bathroom, the bathroom was missing half of the towels a hotel room should have and hair on the bed, floor, bathroom floor and in the tub. Yuck. It's almost like someone spent the night, used a few towels, and then the maid service just made the bed and took the towels without touching anything else. I was too tired to worry about it and got into bed. The bed was like sleeping on the floor. No give at all. The most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. The room also was close to some sort of plumbing room so I heard pumps and running water non stop. I was also next to the elevator and constantly heard people chatting all night. The next morning I asked to change rooms mainly because of how dirty the room was. The front desk was very helpful and moved me to another room later that evening. This room showed me how awful the previous room was because it was much cleaner, had all the amenenties that he previous room was missing and the bed seemed to give one more inch. It was the second worst bed I'd ever slept in. It was however much quieter. The cost overall did not match the rooms and is not a good value. I shouldn’t have to ask for a clean room at these sorts of room prices. Look elsewhere. The only redeeming quality about the hotel was the lovely and caring staff who tried to remedy my problems. The bell desk was prompt and polite. The service in the restaurants was good but the food very expensive. Head down to the Maxwell Street Hawker Center for a much tastier and cheaper meal and eat amongst the locals.

Reviews.Title: “quiet weeekend away ruined by noisy children”
Reviews.Author: hotelvisitor39
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel specifically as it had an adult only swimming pool. However the entire time we were there the place was over run by children. Not wanting to sound like a complete miser but it really ruined the trip. There were no staff around to supervise and when they did appear they ignored the children, even while they were stood underneath the 'adults only' sign. The hotel itself was nice but I wouldnt go again.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: ucans
Reviews.Content: It was my second visit to Singapore and I changed my booking from Marriott to Amara due to the fact that the hotel is stone throw distance from the office I was visiting this time. I regret that decision to change. I had requested a king size bed room whereas I was give a twin bed room. I requested for a change which was accepted and I was told that the I was being given a complimentary upgrade to a higher floor and better room however the other room was not even meeting the standards of first room. The bathroom wasn't great and the towels etc were not really clean. I flew in early morning and checked in and afterwards decided to take a small nap however there were lot of sounds of drilling and someone hammering the wall in the room above mine which was completely disturbing. The breakfast was a buffet one and again not good at all. Very limited choice and refills were not prompt. I wasn't even served coffee at all in all days. First day I had to tell the staff to get me a coffee. Other days the staff would not even bother to ask or send folks to fill coffee / tea and I stopped asking for it. (I wonder was it because I am an Indian). Lady on Egg counter was nice (for a change) and prompt in cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near subway and walking distance to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: EKSAYERS
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice big clean rooms. Lovely pool and good gym.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel needs improvment”
Reviews.Author: Hassanmohd
Reviews.Content: I will not recommend this hotel for the following reasons: 1- I sent enquire to their email before I check in to enquire about the availability of HDMI slot in their television, till date after checking out for more than 2 days they never replied. 2- They have old flat TV in the rooms. 3- I asked the concierge for news paper he just pointed me to a next staff who handed me the newspaper, no body bother to register my name so that I receive it automatically on my door! 4- On the 1st night the bed sheet at on one side was very dirty. 5- I tried BF, lunch and room service (desert) my verdict on the taste is average.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Rocknroller99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week on an extended business trip - lucky me. This is a fabulous hotel. I spent most of the time reminding myself that I was working and not on holiday. There wasn't a single thing that I'd change or comment negatively on. If you are ever lucky enough to get to Singapore then you can't go wrong here. The staff are great, really friendly and although most of them struggle with their pigeon English, all of them, even the cleaners, have a smile and are willing to engage in friendly conversation. Location is brilliant for exploring Singapore and the local restuarants and bars in walking distance are all amazing. Britain still has so much to learn about real customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean but a bit worndown hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcM247
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Double Executive room on the 11th floor thanks to a free upgrade from Deluxe. Reception was friendly and helpfull. We booked breakfast at the hotel which consisted of a Breakfast Buffet, this included all you can wish for in a breakfast ! the rooms are clean but a bit worn downn due to extensive use. Also the bathroom could do with some renovation. the hotel is just a stroll away from public transportation (MRT or underground trains or the tube) which can take you anywhere in the city within minutes. A Seven Eleven shop is just around the corner. Also part of the hotel is a microbrewery "the Prague" for the beer lovers, Just across the streets are shops and eateries. The hotel is maybe not in the city center, but the MRT can take you anywhere in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Family ... Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SantoshTiwari
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in close proximity to all required amenities like market, medical, eating joints, MRT station... overall a perfect place for family to stay and enjoy. Hotel is very good. On the top floor of the hotel, there is entire food court setup with indian food also available. Shopping and late night walking outside the hotel is no problem... even after midnight. For travellers with issues with international food, SUBWAY , MACDONALD is the option available behind the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: beatricedotlee
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for family. We book tripple sharing and the room is just right for all of us. Do stay here if you come just for leisure and on budget. Not great if you come to Singapore for shopping as the shopping places are quite a distance away, need to take the MRT to places and quite inconvenience if you does lots of shopping. However, if you come to Singapore with young kids, and only for sighseeing/leisure, it is a great place as it is so close to MRT and not too far from Resort World/Sentosa Island. The only thing that I do not agree on the room rate is no internet access! Singapore internet access should cost like nothing and I do not understand why this hotel still charge SGD15.00 per hour for internet!!!! I used to stay at Ibis when travelling alone and the room rate is cheaper and still get free internet access. Hope the management would consider to give free access of internet in order to encourage repeater guests.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gdilieto
Reviews.Content: Amara is a solid 4-star hotel with quality of the facility, service and amenities suit to its category by general international standards. The hotel is located in the business district and mainly caters to a crowd of business travelers. For tourists, it is not really in the center of the action but is still decently located at a 10-minute walk to Chinatown and a ~25 to the Quays and, most important, adjiacent to a station of the efficient Singapore's subway network which will take you wherever you want to go, including the airport. I have stayed in this hotel in the past for business traveling and I have returned this time for vacation in the attempt of escaping Orchard's crazy rates and inconsistent quality, and in the whole, for my needs of a tourist, the hotel worked perfectly fine. I would consider returing here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a little bit of luxury...”
Reviews.Author: Pixxidix
Reviews.Content: Location: not excellent, you need to take the metro to get anywhere. About 3 stops from the city center. Room: excellent bed and bathroom. No free internet (SG$15 per hour). The hotel has various restaurants although we haven't tried them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good security, a solid 4* property”
Reviews.Author: GaryinSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights over NY's Eve - a change to my usual hotel which was booked out. The location I think is fantastic -walking distance to Chinatown and the bars on Neil Rd. The MRT is a 5 min walk away, which is fantastic and takes you anywhere you need to get to in Sgp. Rooms are fine, though old-style TV's need updating. The range of TV channels though is excellent. I didn't try the hotel's many dining options as right behind the hotel is a 24/7 (Korean) coffee chain called Tom Tom's, which is very convenient, beside a 7/11 too. The hotel also adjoins a small shopping centre, which contains a food court, Spinelli cafe, Watson's chemist, Subway, Old Chang kee snacks, Burger King etc - so very handy. Plus directly across the street is a Post Office and money changer, plus large supermarket etc. in Tanjong Pagar Plaza. I got an amazing rate for this property through the SIA stopover program, and overall was very satrisfied.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: andy_zu
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th times stay in Amara and so far I'm happy with this hotel. Off course, there were goods and bads about this hotel, but for me, this hotel ticks most of the boxes. The main reasons for me to choose this hotel again and again were simple. It's near business district, close to MRT, close to Chinatown (so it's easy to get food/drinks at anytime), not too expensive, has decent facilities and away from hustle bustle craze of Orchard. Rooms Clean, decent size and have standard amenities. Two complimentary bottled water everyday. Sheets and pillows are clean and smell fresh. Bathroom has standing shower and bathtub. Water taps worked fine, but I must admit the pressure and temperature were most of the times inconsistent, means it took quite a while to get the water from shower meet your desired temperature, especially from cold to hot. Toilettries are standard, incl. hairdryer. TV has decent numbers of channels. Staff In my opinion, quite efficient, but maybe not at anytime helpful. Check-in/check-out was fast. Some housekeeping staff were not really fluent in English (from China?), so it was like hit and miss to get them understand what you want. Location This is the ultimate reason I choose this hotel. It was a walking distance from Tanjong Pagar MRT, and Tanjong Pagar MRT is part of the airport line (East West/Green line), so from Changi airport, you only have to change train at Tanah Merah to continue to Tanjong Pagar and vice versa. This is really convenient for me. It is also close to China Town (just 10 minutes walk), and Maxwell Rd. Food Court (so I can get cheap dishes at anytime till midnight within a walking distance). The Tanjong Pagar area itself has a vibrant nightlife. The hotel is attached to the small shopping centre and there are some eateries (e.g. Burger King, Subway, etc.) so don't worry if you pay for the stay without breakfast. There is also a convenience store (Watson) to buy things like toilettries in case you forgot to bring it. Accross the lobby hotel, there is Tanjong Pagar Plaza, which has several cheap eateries and 24 HR internet cafe. On the other side of the street across from the rear of the hotel, there are 7-11 store and cafes. You will see the 7-11 store everytime you walk from Tj. Pagar MRT to the hotel anyway... :-) Restaurant For the earlier three stays, I paid the hotel without breakfast and nor I tried one of the eight restaurants at the hotel. As I mentioned previously, don't worry, there's a lot of eateries around the hotel. The last time I stay, I decided to pay including the breakfast. It's not bad, although not many of food variety. Taste is okay, but also not too excellent. It's decent for the business traveller. Facilities Nice swimming pool. Towels are provided, plenty of sunbeds. There is also a small 24hr gym, it is good to exercise after dinner. So all in all, I would recommend this hotel for those whose looking for decent 4-star hotel with no frills, good value but have a good facilities and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for short comfortable stays”
Reviews.Author: MithunKr
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we got to stay in this great hotel just for a night. As our flight got cancelled in the evening, and the next flight was next early morning, so we were put up at this hotel by the airlines. Due to the time constraint, couldn't really enjoy the Jacuzzi bath, but even the shower in the cabin was a nice experience. The locality of the hotel is also very prime, walkable from a few attractions of Singapore, and to the closest MRT station to go to any other attractions. Taxi service is a bit expensive; if you can afford it, go fo it. Food in the restaurant is really nice and caters to many taste buds.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible 4 stars standard”
Reviews.Author: vhanh
Reviews.Content: Dear Mr. GM, I took my colleague to have dinner in Elements restaurant last night , hoping to celebrate a happy occasion. But the service proved to be so bad that our mood for celebration was completely spoil.The most recent service which has not met with our expectations. We was seated after waiting about 10 minutes in the front, fine, no hassles.After that, the waitress walked past my table once without greeted , and just carried on, and then my wait began.I waited 5 more minutes for someone to come and offer me menu's, whilst there were this 2 waitress at the till messing around with each other. Had I not been there with my colleague .I would have walked straight out! Finally,The waitress (crystal) was completely disinterested in our table and there was no friendly interaction.The order was took very long, lax service, took even longer for the plates to be removed.We ask to top-up water from her.she totally forgot even though this time not busy .We did not even receive an apology and the waitress made us constantly feel as if we shouldn't ask her for a thing and that we owed her something. I look forward to your cooperation in the matter and wish the matter would be resolved at the earliest.What is the 4 stars hotel standard like this?This is not the quality of Amara hotel that I've come to expect! Someone needs a bit of a wake-up call there! Thanking You, Sincerely, Mina Ng( 84296198)

Reviews.Title: “Well-located corporate hotel, mixed bag of good & bad”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrevLondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Amara a couple of times due to it's proximity to the central business district - it's a short walk to our local offices in Singapore. Reception is efficient, and by & large the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms tends to be small but with everything required in a corporate sort of way, though the bathroom on my last visit was in need of a refit, with unpleasant gurgling from a drain every time someone in a neighbouring room used their bathroom - which was quite disturbing in the night. On my last visit I also had the misfortune of having a room by the lift shaft and ventilation shaft - the noise was extremely annoying at night, and I couldn't be relocated as the hotel was full. Take ear plugs! The breakfast room is also chaotic when the hotel is full - there simply isn't enough space to fit everyone in, despite it having a good selection of food to choose from. Stand up to go to the buffet and you can come back to find your seat taken! One good aspect to the hotel in the pool area, several floors up. It may be overlooked by nieghbouring blocks of flats, but it has enough atmosphere of it's own to really unwind in at the end of the working day. There are some excellent restaurants within the hotel, though these are expensive, but offer plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your hair conditioner.”
Reviews.Author: curiouskitty
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Amara for 1 week, husband was there for conference. The best of this hotel is the executive lounge, as we stayed in the executive level, we entitled to use the lounge. They serve breakfast here, same as on the ground floor, but less busier; they also serve cocktails between 6pm to 8pm, so if you get hungry, you can fill up here with simple snacks like bread roll, salad, soup, sushi etc, before went out for some chilly crabs. The hotel is on walking distance to ChinaTown, and Maxwell food court. A few restaurants on the ground floor as well. And there is a market just opposite, a lot of cheap stuffs, like children books, just 1 Singapore dollar. so ladies if you have lot of free time during the day like me, this is the place to kill time. Downside of the hotel, as many people said, it's a bit age. But the most annoy thing has to be they do not provide hair conditioner. Because I bought tones of souvenirs start from the 1st day, I just don't have extra space(luggage allowance) for the big bottle of the conditioner. If I know it initially, I would brought the travel size toiletry with me from home. We stayed in Orchard Road Hotel last year, they are old as well, but they provide everything.

Reviews.Title: “Dated business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sambakongen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the Amara in end July and was upgraded to a suite, which was much appreciated. The Amara is a typical business hotel which is showing its age. The furniture in the rooms is clearly old, the bath rooms look 20 years old and the TVs are of the old tube-types. Service is good although the attendants at the coffee-shop for breakfast were not helpful at all. After being shown a table, they seated someone else at my table whilst I was at the buffet - upon returning and pointing this out to the staff, they asked me to relocate somewhere else.... If you are on business in the area, Amara and M International are equally good (or poor) and you should pick the hotel only if you wish to stay within walking distance of your office.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, with staff prepared to make your stay more pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela1987
Reviews.Content: We booked Amara from the airport, knowing little about it and not having visited Singapore for some years. We found it to be good value for money, very close to the interesting areas of Chinatown and very comfortable, (without claiming to be luxurious). Most impressive was the excellent service, with the concierge able to recommend an "untouristy" restaurant and the manager allowing us to check out at 4.30 for no extra charge, which made our night flight home much more bearable. Nice pool area too.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative to expensive chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: simoncollier1961
Reviews.Content: The Amara is a bit of a gem. Considerably cheaper than the Orchard Road hotels but with almost the same facilities; its less-affluent location is the only thing I've rated lower. The staff are very friendly and service, particularly housekeeping, is fast. Breakfast is a little chaotic due to small room size, but the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but don't stay here for business!”
Reviews.Author: thedanishtraveller
Reviews.Content: Location: Location is great. Close to MRT, shopping and cheap dining. The hotel is in the same building as a shopping centre, making it very easy to buy take-away and other necessities. Across the street is a super-market, which we used to stock up on breakfast and drinks. There are several restaurants in the neighbourhood and at the hotel as well. Rooms: The hotel room has a good size. The 30 m2 they refer to on their webpage must be inclusive of the bathroom though. The bed is hard, but we slept very nicely in it. The pillows are great. The room is very silent – we couldn’t hear any noise from the hallway, the other rooms or from the outside. Bathrooms: The bathroom has both a tub and a shower, which we liked. The pressure on the water was fine. The bathroom in it self looked at bit tired. It was kept clean everyday; however, the glasses was not replaced only washed and left for drying in the room. Business centre: A major down side! We found it hard to understand, why this would be a preferred business hotel. Internet in the room is really expensive 29 dollar pr. 24 hours! Printing in the business centre is even more ex-pensive, charging 2 SG-dollar pr. printed copy. As I had to print 40 pages for a conference, with print on both sides, that was 40x2x2 dollar – 160 dollar for 40 prints!!! I complained to the manager and got a reduced price, yet still expensive, so printing at this hotel is not recommendable. Room service: We had room service a couple of times, prices were a bit high as one could expect, but noting extraordinary and the food was great! The minibar was very expensive and the items (usual coke, beer etc) was dusty and very dirty - it obviously hadn't been cleaned for some time. Laundry: There is a self-laundry on 8th floor where it is possible to wash and dry clothes. Though we didn’t use it, I appreciated the opportunity. We primarily used the self-laundry for ironing. Staying with a toddler: We stayed with a toddler and he was giving lots of smiles and ‘highfives’ from the staff. We felt welcome and had no trouble. The hotel is however not designed for children, but you can get by without problems. The hotel supplied us with a portable cot, where our son slept ‘like a baby’ for the 10 days we stayed there. The hotel restaurants have high chairs as well. One thing that might cause a problem to other families with kids is that the television does not show any kids channels. In sum a fine hotel but nothing outstanding. If we found a great deal, we might stay there again, but otherwise we would probably look another more family and internet friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Janerty
Reviews.Content: The hotel was rather minimalist and nondescript, but it had a superb location right smack in the middle of Tanjong Pagar. Lots of good food nearby! Our room was clean and comfortable, and quite value for money since we paid less than S$200 for the staycation. The pool looked nice, but we didn't get a chance to go for a dip. If you're planning to visit the gym, you'll be pleased to know that some of the gym machines have a personalized TV monitor. And they even screened Word Cup matches on these gym machines!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpaws
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an acceptable business hotel in Singapore. Its location is very convenient to the MRT and buses to which you can travel to other sections of the city. The breakfast was quite tasty and there was plenty of different foods to fill you up. For an American, the breakfast made you feel comfortable as you knew the foods that were available. For lunch, I found the Element's buffet very expensive, but it was still good. I had dinner in 3 of the restuarants quite good. The hotel, while acceptable needs some work. Here were some observations: 1) Bathroom had a lot of mold on the shower, tub and sinks. 2) Bathroom ceilings needed repainting and many of the joints and paint were peeling 3) Internet was very difficult to actually subscribe to. I had to change the URL that came up when starting up in order to subscribe. In addition, there was no weekly rate. 4) Beds were very hard. In addition, they should offer the deluxe rooms with a single queen bed instead of 2 singles. 5) Walls were paper thin. In fact the drains in the bathrooms made loud neighbors seem even louder as the sounds from ajoining rooms came through them. 6) There were no clocks of any type in the rooms 7) TV selection was limited. There was not even CNN. As noted in another review, the TV's were quite old. The pool was quite nice and refreshing. With some cleanup and some additional forthought, this hotel could elevate itself up one or two steps and become much better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel, terrible service, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: DJDunoon
Reviews.Content: Was kept waiting at check-in for 15 minutes, when I complained I was told that I was lucky to have a room as the hotel was full! Room was worn, paint peeling from wall in bathroom. Windows leaked in 2 separate places. TV was old style small square TV in a very old TV cabinet which looked to be from an old hotel surplus sale. Both nights either my duvet cover or sheets were torn. Room service meal was mediocre at best, and took 45 minutes despite being told 20 mins. General staff attitude was apathetic. Location was great for my business meeting, however I will sacrifice this next time and stay further away in a real hotel. For the money and supposed star rating it was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gigi54
Reviews.Content: We are here for 1 month and the room and level of service is above average. The daily buffet breakfast is very good but the opportunity for an omelet doesn't exist until after 7am. If you have to eat breakfast before 7am do not expect any custom cooking. Concierge is very helpful and friendly. Fitness center adequate. Pool is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A Cool Experince”
Reviews.Author: Merchant1965
Reviews.Content: I visited the Amara Hotel on the recommendation of a friend and was pleasently surprised with the cleanliness of the room, room service, politeness, hospitality of the staff. The hotel is well located in and around the main buisness district, easily accessible, close to the MRT station and all in all a value for money experince. I had some outstanding Thai food in the restaurant below and also enjoyed the well spread out breakfast buffet. All in all I would recommend thi one to a budgetted traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for business travelers and holiday goers”
Reviews.Author: francis8112
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Amara for 8 days, we had previously booked another hotel but after reading really bad reviews about the latter we had to change reservations at the last minute. The only rooms available for that long a period was their Club rooms, the two top most floors of that hotel. Our flight into Singapore arrived around 5:30PM, commuting from Changi Airport took us about 30 minutes to get to the hotel lobby, where the bell staff immediately took over our luggages. The front desk people however weren't really as accommodating, we were asking if lower priced rooms were available and if it's possible for us to transfer, the guy on the desk had several ways of answering us politely, but he chose to answer rather rudely that we already made arrangements with the travel agency and we are bound to pay it. The girl on the team didn't fare so well either as she failed to explain the privileges that are due for staying at club rooms, so we missed out on this a lot. Aside from those two, the other staff were quite friendly and accommodating. Butler service at the club lounge was excellent, the staff knew us by name (well addressed us using our last names) by the next morning. PROS: -Location is great. It's in the business district, a stone's throw away from almost everything that's of interest from a sight-seeing point of view. The subway is practically just outside the driveway of the hotel. Chinatown is 10-15 minutes away. There's mall right beside the lobby. -The is quiet and gives a lot of privacy -Club rooms include butler services, cocktails from 6-8PM every night, complimentary internet, 2 free pieces of laundry everyday. CONS: - Very few TV channels, doesn't even have CNN, Discovery, or NatGeo... I would have settled for the Cartoon Network or Nickelodeon just to have a taste of home. Even HBO fizzes out once in a while. - For the price (SG$410 per night) I would have expected a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkdoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is connected with a small shopping center, where you can find cheap laundry service, fast food restaurants such McDonald and Subway, and a drug store. Amara is located in Central CBD, good for business, 5 minutes walk to Tanjong Pagar MRT station, walking around the area is safe and convenience. The room is pretty small compared to other 4 stars hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual high standard of service for a Singapore hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexingtosia
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing hotel - clearly more a hotel for those travelling on business than on holiday. The bathroom hadn't been cleaned properly (there was a big ball of hair on the bathroom floor!) Restaurant service was very average with things listed on the menu that weren't available (such as wine by the glass); room service phoned 3 times after placing an order for breakfast to say that they had no apple juice, no grapefruit juice and no fresh pineapple, which are all offered on the room service menu. Really poor value for money, and if you're after good views of Singapore, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: malyna009
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Amara a few years ago, and were a bit nervous that our expectations would be too high going back again. But we decided to end our holiday in Australia with a break in Singapore on the way back to the Newzealand, and arranged another Singapore Stopover Holiday (from Singapore Airlines) here. We were disappointed on arrival to find that we had been allocated a twin room, and were told that there was no double room available that night but we would be moved the next day. When we returned from dinner that night we were chatting to a friendly staff member in the foyer and mentioned that we were to be moved, and he said to wait a moment and he would see if he could arrange anything and upgraded us to a suite immediately. The shower was enormous! The Balinese style swimming pool on the sixth floor is wonderful, especially for swimming at night. The gym is fine, and the spa is lovely (although not cheap). The staff here are almost universally friendly and can't do enough to make your stay pleasant. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: a_tempoNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Rooms were well maintained and staff were very friendly and helpful, the beds were comfortable and all in all I had a great stay. I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very rude reception!”
Reviews.Author: somadKL
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 3rd to 6th April, wanted to celebrate my father's birthday in Singapore, so decided to booked this hotel - the rooms were clean and the location is convenient. Everything seems to be perfect until an unpleasant experience at the reception. The staff - Shanti, was rude - my mother asked her for the exchange rates but instead a calculator was shoved in the face, telling her to calculate it herself. As if that wasn't enough, she insulted her by saying "if you want a cheaper rate, go to Chinatown!" This kind of attitude is unnecessary and rude, the staff shouldn't be working at the reception. If this is the kind of hospitality Amara hotel gives, it's a matter of time it'll lose its business.‎

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: BluePoolRoad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my husband for business. The reason for staying here is because this hotel is within working distance of my husband's Singapore office. Pros: Room is clean and bed is comfortable enough It is right next to a shopping mall with lots of choice for food Lots of other shopping areas within walking this distance. This is not your 5 star luxurious hotel but you’ve got all your basic stuff in the room plus free internet service. Staffs on the whole are quite helpful and friendly. Western Food inside hotel is not too bad. Room price is very reasonable for this type of establishment. Cons: It is not close to any attractions and is not close to the center of the city Room is small with dated furnishing but still clean Lighting in the room is quite dark not enough lighting. Slippers given to be wore in the room is as thin as a piece of paper Bathroom has tiny little bar soap (the size of an egg yolk) but they do not replace this tiny soap bar even if you stay for 4 or 5 nights. Bottled water is not provided, you need to buy your own.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bengaluru
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and cozy. Proximity to the MRT station. 7 food options inside the hotel and an excellent food court inside the building. Breakfast had decent vegetarian options - parathas with veg curry and a good spread of fruits and danish. other Asian foods were available. Room cleaning was efficient. My only grouse was the shower was in a corner and bath tub in another corner. Price a bit higher I would say when you get hotels for lesser less than 15 minutes away. Gym well equipped and busy. The pool was a big relief considering the humidity.

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous, efficient and friendly staff, and the hotel is value for money.”
Reviews.Author: sue959
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and found the proximity to Chinatown convenient. Also only a block away from Tanjong Pagar MRT. The shops and restaurants around the hotel were also very convenient. The room and bathroom were very clean and the lobby and reception area very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “In need of repair”
Reviews.Author: CaptainQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Amara and found it to be an thoroughly average business hotel. Check-in was slow despite having booked everying well in advance for my colleagues and me. The room I reveived was badly in need of repair and in general the hotel needs a facelift. Breakfast was good although the staff were found to take their time serving and helping guests. The location of the hotel was OK, not good, not bad. Cannot help thinking there are better hotels in Singapore around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A simple hotel in an older part of town”
Reviews.Author: ningen
Reviews.Content: I was reading some of the reviews of this hotel and I cant help but wonder where the reviews are coming from. We are the owner of the Amara property timeshares since the early 1980s. Everytime we checked into the hotel they give us exactly the same room which in my opinion is really old and worn out and seriously in need of some real renovation. Perhaps they put all their timeshare owners in the same room, and those "paying" customers in nicer rooms..... But we did pay for the time shares and yearly maintenance fees (at which they increase at their own discretion)! The carpeting is old and dirty I have to walk around in shoes and the shower stall is always stuck with water that pools and overflow. Perhaps they should start to spend some real money on Draino? The furniture (aka sofa, desk, chair etc) are so mirky I wouldnt put my dirty laundy on them. That having said, its in a nice location. The lobby looks nice and well kept, the housekeeping did their best to clean up our room everytime we stayed, but theres only so much you can do to clean up worn out places that requires renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel With Extraordinray Service in Singaore's Chnatown”
Reviews.Author: WillieTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Amara is perfectly located in Singapore's Chinatown section only a few blocks from two MRT stations and a reasonable walk to most of the sights of the City. The hotel is spotlessly clean, beautifully maintained, with a very nice 6th floor pool. The rooms are reasonably sized with all amenities (including good television channels). There are numerous restaurants in hotel but I ate at the many hawker centers (offering extraordinary value). However, the greatest attribute of the hotel is the staff which are professional, efficient, kind, and incredibly nice. In a city known for doing things quickly and well, the Amara staff excels--and I shall always stay at this hotel when I travel to Singapore. While there are more luxurious (and far more expensive) hotels in the City, the value for price of this hotel is extraordinary. Singapore is a great city to visit. I would recommend taking the Walking Tours that are offered--they are brilliant and thorough. The Singapore National Museum and the Asian Civilizations Museum are two musts. As stated, the hawker centers are places where you can eat a great meal for $6.00 to $8.00. There are, of course many good restaurants but I would urge you to avoid the many on the river in CBD--they are expensive and not very good. I challenge anyone to find a more efficient airport--and one which provides free internet *(and computers to use ). Hope you find the city as wonderful as I did--and seriously consider the Amara.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: samirgala
Reviews.Content: I was on a Business visit with my colleagues from 6 July 2009 to 10 July 2009 and had booked 4 single rooms at Amara, Singapore. The reason we book the Hotel because of the reasonable price, close proximity to Financial District The stay was excellent and the staff is friendly. The Thai restaurant at Amara is quite popular and you should try the Thai food here. The Hotel also has a shopping centre attached which provided access for us after office hours. Overall an excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great staff and delicious food”
Reviews.Author: larssin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and we are very pleased with everything here. The hotel is away from the crowd with nice room, friendly and helpful staff . We will stay here again if we come back to Singapore next time. It should be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RG1Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Amara Hotel has a great location, bang in the business district, near Robinson road....offices are within walking distance. Well equipped rooms for business travellers; takes care of the daily necessities. Room size is good too for the rooms on higher floors. It has many restaurants, a great Balinese sytle swimming pool and courteous and helping staff. There is a market right in front for various purposes - it has NTUC, Salons, FX etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wow ,wow, wow”
Reviews.Author: phillipislandfamily
Reviews.Content: What a delight this hotel was. Great service and lovely staff that were competent and efficient . The room were lovely and great comfy beds. Absolutely fabulous resturants, I think there were 5 each with a different cuisine. Great seafood smorgie available ,which was just exceptional value . The pool was really lovely and clean with a great garden around it. Our stay was truelly enjoyable and I cant wait to return. The business centre was very good and efficiently run for a small charge. The staff in the reception couldnt do enough for us and it also has an inexpensive shopping centre including nice resturants as part of the complex. This hotel was very affordable and good value

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Binaj
Reviews.Content: Wow, a nice hotel in a good location. Clean rooms with all the ncecessary facilities and the bathroom was big and nice. A nice swimming pool and a good lobby area. The service was great, because we had children the hotel allowed us to check in early and checkout really late the next day. The service was great and the location was easy access to all the areas. We even walked from the train station to the hotel. Thank you folks at the Amara...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but staff does not have service mind”
Reviews.Author: Paula_Jeans
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via internet due to its convenient location and reputation. Yet, I am disappointed. Despite the great location (5 min. walk to MRT, 3 min. to shopping center and local market), we did not get a warm welcome from front desk staff. When room change was requested for non-smoking one, a bell boy came up only to exchange the new key room and escort us to the elevator door. He did not even bother offering helping out with our luggage which I had trouble handling them. I feel they did not have service mind at all. Is it because we got special rate through internet and so we receive inferior service to others?

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: benakm
