Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for a night with someone as i needed to leave for Batam Island early next morning. Didn't get to enjoy the hotel facilities much but overall a comfortable stay i say. A nicely situated hotel near clubbing and dining areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shonaa
Reviews.Content: Near to the financial hub at Tanjong Pagar. Good connectivity of teh MRT(trains) to Raffel and other areas. Not much Indian Food. But one can find that near to the place just ask the reception

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Oliverstaunton
Reviews.Content: Forget breakfast it is 3 star, burnt greasy bacon, chicken nuggets labled as sausages, no pork sausages, despite having bacon ( so the no pork excuse does not fly) no yoghurts, and juice that tastes like water. Service is just as bad I asked for coffee 3 times, when it was eventually served it was typical burnt Kona coffee. Vietnames restaurant had rats running around outside.( authentic??) rooms very dated 90s style, old small TVs, no luggage racks, worn carpets, swimming pool has no atmosphere and the sound and smell of the hotel extract system does not add to it. Pool tiles cracked, towels thin, and worn out.

Reviews.Title: “clean, efficient, comfortable, stylish 4 start hotel”
Reviews.Author: ekou3
Reviews.Content: you can smoke in the rooms if you wish - which for me was a bonus. located amongst some great local eateries as well as western resteraunts. has a great pool on the 6th floor - a must for those hot singapore days. a 2 minute walk to the subway and part of a shopping plaza as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable and Conveniently Located hotel”
Reviews.Author: tntcat22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and used it as a base from which to explore singapore. So lets get the bad thing out of the way first, its not great for food or drink being far to expensive when just over the road are some great local food outlets which give you far better value for money, and which allow you to eat like a local. Well thats it for the bad, the rooms are what you would expect for a hotel of this type and are adequate for all your needs providing your not going to be spending alot of time in them,which we didn't. Remember Singapore is a place to explore and not a place geared up for relaxing around a pool. An MRT station is located a couple of minutes walk from the hotel and all the best places to go are just a few stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding @ Amara”
Reviews.Author: chefaujus
Reviews.Content: We got married at Amara last year.. Free 1 night complimentary stay.. Beautiful rooms, service was ok.. Breakfast not much choices.. Overall is still good..

Reviews.Title: “Worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgainOslo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for little more than a week at the Amara in week 27/28, travelling for work to Singapore. I choosed an "executive" room and got one on the 12th floor. The hotel was extremely conveniently located for me as I had to work at several places around Shenton way and could anywhere by walk. However, I have extremely dispointed of the hotel room compared their pricing. While rooms are of adequate size they seem not to have been renovated for decades. The ceiling of batroom was falling down and you could see at several places mushrooms on the painting. Everything was quite dirty (windows, doors, mirror, bath) and was not consistently cleaned during my stay. Plumber need to refurbishement also as the sink took ages to empty ... The desk was burned on several places. Restaurant with buffet is ok, but nothing compared to the ones at the Marriot for instance (at an equivalent price). In any case, I will not come back to this hotel up untill they undertake major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “business hotel”
Reviews.Author: koolguysg
Reviews.Content: Amara is one of the best hotels i have stayed in singapore and its a business hotel and located in the CBD and also located near to the Tanjong pagar MRT. the night life around the hotel is very good and you can also get good western food around the area in some places as the hotel is located near the shopping complex and you will get some good food and wine. i stayed during the christmas season and they also provided a bottle of wine to the all customers during their stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good hotel at Tanjong Pagar”
Reviews.Author: ManFromTheEast
Reviews.Content: Check-in: hassle-free; bonus - upon seeing my daughter, they offered to give an extra bed free of charge; another bonus - agreed to a late check-out, again, free of charge Room: spacious, clean, and was clearly ready for us; the bathroom came with a decent tub but the separate shower cubicle was a bit small; drawback - no cable Amenities: loved the feel of the pool; gym was so-so, not very well-thought out and did not have any trainers at all; i was itching to have a massage after a long and tiring day but the spa is only good until 8pm, which is quite too early Staff: great front desk lady (who gave us the free bed); very attentive doormen - they are there even before the need arises; reliable housekeeping Location: a stone throw away from the Tanjong Pagar MRT station, very accessible; the hotel is connected to a mall Check-out: smooth as the check-in; no extra hidden charges

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenM72
Reviews.Content: I stay every month in this hotel, since it is close to my office. The hotel is clean, with a good pool and a small gym. .MRT line is a short walk away, and China town about a 10 min walk away. Staff are friendly, there are a number of good restaurants in the hotel, and a shopping mall next door. Wireless is available (for a cost, or free, depending on your room package). Only 2 minor negatives, 1 the air cond is sometimes too high (and when turned down, does not go down all the time), 2 no body cream in the amentities in the room (but you can get it if you ask reception).

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nizocold
Reviews.Content: very good hotel reasonably priced and convenient location one can walk in ten minutes from here to china town and to shopping centres like funan etc great breakfast very sumptuous with good omlettes that chef makes the way u want them too large spread which indians will enjoy they have anice restuarant as well in case one waNTS TO EAT IN THE HOTEL BUT WHEN IN SINGAPORE DPO EAT OUT AT THE CLARK OR RIVE QUOY OR AT SUNTEC CITY ETC

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled like a bar”
Reviews.Author: CelisaB
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Singapore on a layover from Malaysia to USA. We decided to treat ourselves to a 'nice' hotel since we generally stay in small guesthouses/hostels. We arrived at 5pm and the room wasn't ready yet (even though we had made an advance reservation). When we were allowed in the room it reeked of cigarette smoke. We asked the front desk if we could change rooms as we are both non-smokers and they told us there were only single bed rooms available for non-smoking. For the price we paid (around $215 US) it was an terrible waste of money because we couldn't even enjoy hanging out in the room. It literally smelled worse than most bars I've been too that allow smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Amara”
Reviews.Author: BelfastAussie_9
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Amara a few years ago, and were a bit nervous that our expectations would be too high going back again. But we decided to end our holiday in Australia with a break in Singapore on the way back to the UK, and arranged another Singapore Stopover Holiday (from Singapore Airlines) here. We were disappointed on arrival to find that we had been allocated a twin room, and were told that there was no double room available that night but we would be moved the next day. When we returned from dinner that night we were chatting to a friendly staff member in the foyer and mentioned that we were to be moved, and he said to wait a moment and he would see if he could arrange anything and upgraded us to a suite immediately. The shower was enormous! The Balinese style swimming pool on the sixth floor is wonderful, especially for swimming at night. The gym is fine, and the spa is lovely (although not cheap). The staff here are almost universally friendly and can't do enough to make your stay pleasant. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value at Amara”
Reviews.Author: jogjacrew
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to a Tanjong Pagar MRT station, so we used the metro a lot. The hotel is modern and as far as I could tell no major signs of aging in the rooms or elsewhere. Rooms had great lighting, marble tile in bathroom (separate bath and shower was great!). The mattresses were very firm and a highlight of our stay. The AC worked well (not always the case in Singapore hotels!), and there was tasteful art on the walls. The rooftop pool was on the cooler side and was always very quiet, but our kids had fun swimming. Breakfast was adequate (included in our rate) but was the same every day, so by day 4 we were ready to go home and eat something different. This being said they did serve roti paratha for breakfast which is unusual. Other small areas of needing improvement: no TV channels for kids to watch, the fridge wasn't very cold, view not so good from 9th floor, and some of the linens were stained.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Susannaka
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel with fine rooms within walking distance from China town etc. Staff was friendly and helped me with many errands. Nice lobby bar and breakfest room. Plus a great massage place at the hotel as well as pool.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: meowcsj
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here a lot times. Have weekend promotion. Thus is relative cheap compared to others of its standard. The room and bathroom is spacious. The bed is comfy. It has a balinese style swimming pool. It is in CBD, thus no much shopping during weekends. Across the roads are the local shops with 7 eleven. 5 min walk to MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: genesis53
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one week in the Amara while attending The Pacific Rim Conference at Nus Guild House in 2004. It was my first overseas experience and I was not dissapointed. The service was great, the rooms were very comfortable and I felt extremely comfortable being able to lock my valuables away in a safe in my room being a very nervous first time traveller. The concierge went out of there way to oblige, the food in the resturant was fantastic. The most complete breakfast I have ever experienced. The cold coffee was probably the only dissapointment but if that was all I give the Amara 9 out of 10. The Hotel is extremely close to China Town which I walked daily. It was close to our companion Naturopathic Clinic in Keta Ayer Road to which we also walked and even walked all the way back from Orchard road in the searing heat just for the experience and everything was very accessible. As far as standards go I felt this Hotel was equal to 41/2 to 5 star Australian and I was told that before I went and was not dissapointed. Would I stay there again. Yes I cannot wait to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Amara”
Reviews.Author: marknmeils
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Amara and had no complaints. The hotel is located toward the southern part of the CBD, so some distance from the main shopping areas. However, the hotel is only a few minutes away from the Tanjong Pagar MRT station and we found the trains to be efficient and quite cheap. Our room, on the 9th floor, was huge with a king size bed. As mentioned in other reviews, the decor was basic but except for a few small niggles (ie. some mould in the shower and slight trace of previous smoking) was tidy and clean. The best part of our stay, however, was the use of the pool and pool area which was a great place to relax and cool off. The food at the Vietnamese restuarant/bar (Hue) can also be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “False Alarm in Amara Hotel, Sep 11th, 2008”
Reviews.Author: Kaena
Reviews.Content: Right now, 11 September 2008, I am still staying at Amara. I have not move out yet considering the bad experience that I had approximately 2 hours ago. And that is because first, the sponsor picked the hotel for me. Second, it was happening at around 2 o'clock in the morning. So, I had no choice. The fire alarm was ringing at 2 o'clock in the morning. When I got out, something is really wrong because the lift didn't work (as what happened during fire) and nobody at the reception answered my call (how stupid I am, that call made me to run back to my room and then being left by other people). So, I finally made to the emergency exit door. Through the stairs, from my 9th fl room to the 1st fl, nobody from the hotel assisted me. I had to run alone, with my socks on, in a very smelly and dirty stairs. Seemed that the hotel never pay attention to this area. When finally I reached the first fl and open the exit door. Still no hotel staf there. I had to run in the darkness by myself. And when I reached the lobby, some guests already there. Later I knew that they are from 8, 9, 15, and 17 fl. When I gathered with the others (around 10 guests), the hotel staffs explained simply that it was a false alarm and asked us to go back to our room. Just simple as that. Not even a sorry came from their mouth. How can we be sure that it was only a false alarm. Why he's so sure and make that statement only about 15-20 mins after the alarm?. Can't they checked it more comprehensively?. So, finally a guy from India suggested that we wrote something to the management about all of that and asked for further explanation. Well, this was a very bad experience for me. If this happened in my country, Indonesia, somehow I can accept that. We somewhat less developed compare to Singapore. Anyway...maybe I just put too much expectation. So, we'll see tomorrow, what will the management say about this matter. Hope this review helps. Kiki

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: JamieCLondon
Reviews.Content: 2 Nights. Great stay. Great pool. Had a Tropical Six room. Nothing really tropical about it though. And to open the window I had to boost up from a sofa to reach a ledge, and then stretch to open to window, I'm 6'1 and even to me it was hard to reach. They let me check in 2 hours early which is to be commended. For dinner go round to the Maxwell food centre. Great food and hardly any tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but issues with booking”
Reviews.Author: Kipperlug
Reviews.Content: Everything in the Amara was of a high standard. Breakfast was great. We booked a double room using Octopus website, when we arrived we were given a twin room and told a double would cost a lot more. After a lot of arm twisting and arguing the front desk staff at upgraded us for free. This was the only sour point in an otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: danations
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY: An average business hotel with all the expected amenities. No special character, but a pleasant and reasonably comfortable stay. Would have no problems staying here again if needed, but at this price range there are plenty of alternatives to choose from that will offer likely similar experiences. I will be trying another hotel next time in Singapore as there was nothing particular about this hotel that draws you back. Overall though, the stay was comfortable enough. SERVICE: Overall, no complaints. Our arrival at midnight was pleasant since there were no surprises - check-in was smooth and quick. The bell staff on hand was eager to suggest nearby late night eating options with us, which was helpful after 28 hours of airplane food. There weren't any other service points to speak of, as we didn't make any special requests or require any special attention, but overall the staff was polite, friendly, and made our stay comfortable. LOCATION: Not central (i.e., not located near Orchard Road) but very practically located nonetheless: 5 minute walk to the closest subway (MRT), as well as a 5 minute walk to the Maxwell Food Centre, which is an amazing experience for foodies (rows of outdoor stalls under one large compound roof) for varied, local, and cheap & delicious fare. We were able to get everywhere we wanted to go quickly via the extensive MRT routes, thus the placement is quite ideal while not being extremely busy right outside the hotel door. The hotel is quite close to Chinatown, however, so eating options abound within 10-15 minutes of walking. Approx 20 minute Taxi ride to the airport if arriving after 11:30 PM, otherwise, the MRT does stop right inside the airport for an extremely cheap alternative (although quite a bit lengthier - it took about 1 hour to get to the airport via this method.) HOTEL GROUNDS: The hotel itself is modern and classy enough for a business hotel. No complaints. The pool is beautiful and wonderfully relaxing - as close to a mid-city oasis that a standard business hotel pool can be. You will not find a nicer outdoor pool of this style at any similarly priced hotels in Singapore. The pool is large enough to do laps, as well as being a wonderul place to just relax. ROOMS & ACCOMODATION The room feels slightly on the smaller side, for two poeple. The space is functional, but not overly spacious. The bathroom, on the other hand, is spacious and beatifully laid in marble, and feels quite luxurious, with both marble shower and separate tub for bathing. The beds were average firm. CLEANLINESS: The room itself was clean and spotless, but the bathroom was dirtier than what you would expect from a business class hotel (example: we had to re-clean our toilet seat.) Bathroom amenities were replaced daily. Viva the Singapore Sling!

Reviews.Title: “Did not really feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Leseratte
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amara Singapore for three days and were given a polite but not very warm welcome. After the friendliness and warmth of the staff at the Furama in Da Nang and the Angkor Century in Siem Reap, this was like a cold shower. The room was ok, the front desk staff not very helpful when it came to asking information about sights and maps. The atmosphere in the breakfast room was not very nice, I would even call it unpleasant. All in all we did not really feel at home. The Amara may be conveniently located for business travellers but I would not recommend it to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “A catalogue of errors”
Reviews.Author: PleUK
Reviews.Content: We were recommended the Amara by friends, who had a fantastic stay there. I can't say the same sadly! Check in was a shambles. Of our 3 nights there, we were woken at 7am by alarm calls we hadn't requested - THEN - on the final day when we DID request an alarm call in order to catch out flight, we didn't receive it! The plug got stuck in the bath on out second evening, while it was full. We informed reception of this at 5pm and, when we returned to our room at 3am we found it was still stuck, and full of dirty, cold bath water! We had also booked a taxi for the airport through the concierge the night before we left. We were informed it would be $x, which we kept aside in the currency. When it was 10 minutes overdue we started to panic, but no one seemed keen to chase it up. Then it transpired that it hadn't been booked at all. So they called another one, which turned out to be an executive airport car - we only knew this when we got to the airport (with very very little time to spare for our flight by now) and were charged twice as much as the Amara had quoted! Luckily the driver accpeted credit cards - if not we would surely have missed the flight. Overall the hotel was lovely aesthetically, and very clean, but the service and organisation were very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: TamaraTasmania
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Amara on my way to and from Vietnam in March and April 2007. I booked the hotel from the Singapore Stopover brochure and was a bit concerned when I read the previous negative review, But the hotel was a good choice. This was my fourth visit to Singapore. I'm not a shopper, and I was keen to explore Chinatown this time. The location of the hotel was great. It was also one of the quietest hotels I've stayed in. And it's close to the Maxwell Rd hawker stalls and the Blue Ginger restaurant where the food is excellent. There is an MRT a few minutes away. My rooms on both visits were clean and comfortable, though a lingering smell of smoke makes me suspect that people still smoke in the non smoking rooms. I found the concierges very helpful and the service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but ok”
Reviews.Author: DADA13
Reviews.Content: On our way to Sydney we did a two-day stopover in Singapore and booked through Singapore Airlines. The room seemed a little dirty and old. The bathroom was old. You definetly didn't want to take a bath in the tub. Housekeeping would wake you up early even if you put the sign not to disturb. I had a pedicure at the Spa, which was very good. The small pool was also god. The Bar was alright but the cocktails weren't very good. To summarize: ok for a couple of nights when you are out all day exploring the city, but definetly nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful concierges”
Reviews.Author: morrison06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Singapore Stopover from Singapore Airlines as part of our honeymoon, and it was wonderful. Impeccable Singaporean service, a lovely hotel, a a truly spectacular swimming pool. We stayed their twice and the first room we stayed in had a shower so big I could lie across it on the floor. (The second room had a normal-sized shower!) The rooms are comfortable and a reasonable size and very clean. But it's the Balinese style swimming pool that is really spectacular. Outside on the 6th floor, it is surrounded by tropical foliage. Fountains spurt into one side of the pool. Swimming at night is lovely. The concierges at the hotel were the most helpful I've even encountered, particularly the evening concierge. His advice on places to eat, where to get genuine electronics bargains, what was happening on any particular night really made our stay great. Instead of directing us to the hotel's restaurant, or another venue paying him a commission to send tourists there, he told us about a street closed off that night for satay stalls and a firewalking event at an Indian temple. Our stay at the Amara really couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, good facilities, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: james2anne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Amara Hotel for three nights in February 2006. This was at the end of a 5-week round-the-world trip taking in the USA, Australia and Singapore, and the Amara was the best hotel we stayed in, as well as the cheapest! We had purchased a "Singapore Stopover" package through Singapore Airlines and the Amara was amazing value at only £38/night. The room was on the 15th floor and was spacious and quiet. Nicely decorated and furnished too. The hotel has five or six restaurants, and we always ate in the hotel restaurants rather than using local restaurants, which was unusual for us. There is a swimming pool, although we were too busy to use it. The location was fine - in Chinatown and with a subway station less than 5 minutes walk away. All the staff were very polite, attentive and helpful, and we don't understand some of the comments made by other TrypAdvisor users!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Amara Singapore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 5 night stay at the Amara Singapore Hotel. 1. On entering our room, there was a sticky substance on the floorboards under the curtains, and there was no price list for the minibar items which was very deceptive. 2. Housekeeping staff called our room to see when we wanted our room cleaned on the 29th Dec 2005. After a time was agreed upon, we were very upset when we returned at 11pm that night to see our room had not been attended to. 3. On the night of the 30th dec 2005 after asking a man at the reception desk could we have a newspaper delivered in the mornings, again we were disappointed that the next moring a newspaper was not delivered, and we had to ask again. Also on this day our room access card failed to work, and had to be corrected, and when our room was cleaned, no toilet paper was left. 4. Our biggest disappointment would have to be when we checked out early the morning of the 2nd January 2006. When we went to finalise our bill and were told we had to pay for 3 lots of breakfasts we had had during our stay. We were told on check-in that room and breakfast were included in the rate. We didn't think we chose the breakfast option, so both myself and my partner asked the woman at check-in again if this was correct and breakfast was included and she said yes. We were told at check-out that correspondence from our travel agent stating breakfast was NOT included had been recieved early november 2005 as dated by the Amara, but had not been looked at until 2-3 days into our stay late december. Even after the fax stating the correction was noticed by your staff we were not told about this and continued to have breakfast unaware. We would have expected a message stating the change from reception, or even been told at breakfast by the staff there. We found this to be either very poor communication and organisation within your hotel, or highly deceptive in getting more money out of tourists. We were then told by the manager at check-out he would only charge us for 2 of the breakfasts, and not the 3rd. We found this unacceptable, as we checked and checked again about the inclusion of breakfast, and were never informed of any change. Finally after refusing to pay the bill and some heated words we were told we wouldn't be charged then, but may be charged when someone more senior and responsble can make the decision. We found your hotel staff to be rude and disrespectful, with know acknowledgement from them that they had done anything wrong. This has tarnished an otherwise wonderful stay we had in Singapore for 10 nights and its a shame it was the last impression we had of Singapore. The first 5 nights was at the Traders Hotel, and i can assure you these incidences would have never occurred there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, snug room”
Reviews.Author: rmwhitt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amara Hotel near Chinatown for 2 wks. Good location near restaurants/hawker's market, next to MRT stop. Small adjacent shopping center was convenient but not exciting. Drawbacks: Room was on the small side, almost no drawers for clothes, view from 2 different rooms was not impressive. Service was good,esp. on club floor where I stayed, pool area is lovely but no jacuzzi. Turndown service as advertised was nonexistant first week but started in my 2nd week. OK value for the $$ if you get a good discount web rate. Used by airline personnel.

Reviews.Title: “poor housekeeping at Amara”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Amara for a total of 7 days and in that time our bedsheets were not changed because we failed to put the little green clover leaf on the bed, indicating we want our sheets to be changed. On the backside of this little leaf there is another instruction. Leave all your towels you want changed in the bathtub. Tourists & businessmen are often too busy to read this little love note left by housekeeping. For a couple of days we had no maid service even after we called housekeeping & reception. There was mold around corners of the bathtub. The room wasn't vacuumed the days we were there. Amara is a great place to stay except for poor and lazy housekeeping.
